reinforcements.new_element_id: works-001 (Recursive Trial Architecture: Each Stay Cycle as a Complete Micro-Initiation)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: works-002 (Design for the Depleted User at Every Step After the First)
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the psychological cost of multi-step recursive processes. The existing element uses Kahneman's ego depletion to prescribe smart defaults, save-and-resume, and decompression moments across phase sequences. The new element uses Campbell's Road of Trials to prescribe visible progression, micro-reward signals, and cumulative history within the recurring stay cycle. Both identify that a sequence of identical-looking steps produces fatigue (Kahneman) or monotony (Campbell), and both prescribe differentiation signals at each step.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: depleted decision-makers default to denial (parole judge study). Campbell evidence: 'Dragons have now to be slain and surprising barriers passed -- again, again, and again. Meanwhile there will be a multitude of preliminary victories' (lines 428-431). The combined insight: each stay cycle depletes the guest cognitively (Kahneman) AND must be experienced as cumulative progression rather than repetition (Campbell). Smart defaults (Kahneman) reduce per-stay friction while progression markers (Campbell) transform the repetitive structure into a visible growth arc.

reinforcements.new_element_id: works-002 (Belly of the Whale Orientation: Structuring Move-In as Guided Descent)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: communicates-001 (Anchor-Then-Advance: Open Every Screen with What the Host Already Knows)
reinforcements.similarity: Both govern the sequencing of information at critical transition moments. The existing element prescribes anchoring in known data before presenting new demands (Kahneman's associative coherence at phase transitions). The new element prescribes a seven-gate progressive information sequence that strips uncertainty layer by layer as the guest approaches move-in (Campbell's Inanna descent). Both agree: recognition before demand, known before unknown, structured descent rather than information dump.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: System 1 approves transitions that signal continuity with prior context. Campbell evidence: Inanna's descent through seven gates, each stripping one ornament -- 'Extraordinarily have the decrees of the nether world been perfected. Do not question the rites.' The combined insight: the seven-gate move-in sequence IS an anchor-then-advance pattern applied to the guest's physical threshold crossing. Each gate anchors the guest in what they now know (Gate 1: neighborhood) before advancing them to what they will confront next (Gate 2: building access).

reinforcements.new_element_id: works-003 (Meeting with the Goddess: Negotiation as Ritual of Mutual Revelation)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: communicates-005 (Pre-Packaged Proposal: Present Decisions as Confirmations, Not Constructions)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe that negotiation surfaces must present relational context alongside transactional terms. The existing element uses Kahneman's confirmation-vs-construction distinction to pre-populate proposal data. The new element uses Campbell's tale of Niall and the hag to prescribe person-first counter-offer presentation with host reasoning visible. Both aim to reduce the cognitive and emotional cost of the negotiation decision by surfacing the right information in the right order.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: confirmation is effortless, construction is depleting. Campbell evidence: Fergus sees only ugliness (terms-first) and refuses; Niall sees the person and embraces. The combined insight: pre-population (Kahneman) reduces cognitive construction cost, while person-first presentation (Campbell) reduces the emotional Fergus reflex. Both serve the same outcome -- higher counter-offer acceptance -- but operate at different psychological levels.

reinforcements.new_element_id: works-005 (Apotheosis Through Retention: The Guest Transformed by Shared Living)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: feels-005 (Forward Momentum at the Close: Every Interaction Should End Looking Ahead)
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the emotional design of continuation moments. The existing element prescribes forward momentum at every interaction close. The new element targets the lease-end moment specifically with Campbell's Apotheosis: the guest must see their transformation (retrospective mirror) before being offered the forward path (re-lease or new search). The new element is the retention-specific application of the existing forward-momentum principle, enriched with a retrospective dimension that the existing element lacks.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing evidence: every close should look ahead (Kahneman's associative momentum). Campbell evidence: 'He transcends life with its peculiar blind spot and for a moment rises to a glimpse of the source' (lines 1719-1720). The combined insight: at micro-interactions, forward momentum alone suffices. At the macro-retention decision (lease end), retrospective transformation must be established BEFORE forward momentum is offered. The Bodhisattva pauses before continuing -- so must the platform.

reinforcements.new_element_id: communicates-002 (Trial Progression Dashboard: Cumulative Stay Record as Wayfinding)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: ds-ui-003 (Stays Manager Weekly Dashboard with Three-Zone Architecture)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe a zoned dashboard architecture for stay management. The existing element defines three zones for the guest Stays Manager (hero card, upcoming stays, historical stays). The new element proposes a progression-first timeline that replaces the flat chronological list with a visual arc showing completed, current, and future stays as a Road of Trials map. Both agree the dashboard must surface today's answer first; the new element adds a temporal-progression dimension.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing evidence: the guest Stays Manager must surface today's answer first (three-zone urgency hierarchy). Campbell evidence: 'preliminary victories, unretainable ecstasies, and momentary glimpses of the wonderful land' (lines 430-431) -- the guest must see their accumulated victories. The combined insight: the three-zone architecture (existing) provides structural clarity; the progression timeline (new) provides emotional context. Both can coexist: the timeline sits within the hero zone of the three-zone layout.

reinforcements.new_element_id: communicates-004 (Amulet Framing: Platform Tools as Supernatural Helpers)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: behaves-001 (Instant Acknowledgment on Every Host Input)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe that platform interactions must feel like extensions of the user's agency rather than bureaucratic submissions. The existing element ensures sub-100ms feedback on every input. The new element reframes the labeling and information architecture of active-lease tools (Date Change, cleaning photos, arrival) from compliance language ('Submit,' 'Request') to agency language ('Adjust Your Schedule,' 'Show Your Space Is Ready'). Both serve the same principle: the platform as invisible aid, not visible authority.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: instant acknowledgment prevents uncertainty gaps that trigger negative evaluation. Campbell evidence: 'The hero is covertly aided by the advice, amulets, and secret agents of the supernatural helper' (lines 22-24) -- covertly aided, meaning the tool's support is felt without the tool's governance being foregrounded. The combined insight: speed (Kahneman) and framing (Campbell) both contribute to the feeling that tools serve the user, not the platform.

reinforcements.new_element_id: communicates-005 (Transformation Credential: Making the Guest's Initiation Visible)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: communicates-003 (Trust Credential Stack: Process Before Promise, Verification Before Claim)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe that trust evidence must be surfaced in structured credential blocks. The existing element structures trust as mechanism -> specific instance -> guarantee for the host viewing guest proposals. The new element structures the guest's own transformation as a dual-facing profile: guest-facing reflection + host-facing trust credential. Both agree that trust is built through visible evidence, not bare assertions.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing evidence: Bryant's trust sequence (credit check -> pre-authorization -> guarantee). Campbell evidence: the Bodhisattva's 'divine grace of assisting presence' (lines 1811-1812) -- the experienced guest's history is a gift to the marketplace. The combined insight: the trust credential stack (existing) governs how hosts evaluate guests; the transformation credential (new) governs how the guest sees themselves. Both use the same data (stays, reviews, verification) but serve different audiences and emotional needs.

reinforcements.new_element_id: looks-001 (Trial Progression Timeline: Visual Mapping of the Road of Trials)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: ds-ui-005 (Status Badge System: Color-Coded Glanceability Across All Stays Manager States)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe color-coded visual indicators for stay states. The existing element uses badges with distinct colors for each stay status. The new element uses a horizontal timeline with filled (completed) vs. outlined (future) nodes in the accent palette. Both solve the same scan-pattern problem: the guest must perceive stay status at a glance without reading text.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing evidence: color-coded badges reduce the host's need for text-reading to assess stay status. Campbell evidence: filled-vs-outline nodes are the visual translation of 'preliminary victories' -- each filled circle IS a slain dragon. The combined insight: status badges (existing) communicate individual stay states; the timeline (new) communicates the arc across all stays. Badges are local; the timeline is global. Both are needed.

reinforcements.new_element_id: looks-002 (Counter-Offer Warmth: Person-First Visual Treatment for Negotiation)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: looks-001 (Warm Surface Continuity: The First 2 Seconds Must Feel Like the Same Conversation)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe warm visual foundations as trust signals. The existing element uses warm off-white surfaces for page backgrounds to pass System 1's trust gate. The new element uses warm surface backgrounds and serif host-name typography to present the counter-offer as a relational act rather than a ledger update. Both agree: warmth is the pre-cognitive trust signal that must precede content evaluation.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: warm tones prime approach behavior within 200ms. Campbell evidence: the goddess is 'redeemed by the eyes of understanding' (line 673) -- the counter-offer visual treatment IS the lens through which the guest sees the host. The combined insight: warm surface continuity (existing) establishes the baseline trust environment; counter-offer warmth (new) applies that principle specifically to the highest-stakes negotiation moment.

reinforcements.existing_element_id: behaves-003 (Confirm-Not-Construct: Present Decisions as One-Tap Confirmations)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe single-action confirmation paths for high-stakes decisions. The existing element presents decisions as confirmations the user can accept with one tap. The new element extends this to counter-offers with THREE co-equal paths (accept, counter, message) where each is a single tap to initiate. The accept path is a direct confirmation (existing pattern); the counter and message paths add dialogue options that Campbell's Niall model demands.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: confirmation is cognitively effortless. Campbell evidence: Niall did not merely accept the minimum (a kiss) -- he exceeded it ('I will even hug thee!'). The combined insight: one-tap confirmation (Kahneman) is necessary for the accept path; the counter and message paths require equally low friction to ensure the guest is not funneled into binary accept/reject by cognitive cost alone.

reinforcements.new_element_id: behaves-004 (Date Change Tool as Hero's Amulet: Agency-First Schedule Navigation)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: behaves-004 (Save-and-Resume: The Platform Remembers Where You Stopped)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe that the guest's investment and state must be preserved across interactions. The existing element covers draft preservation (auto-save, exact-state resume). The new element covers schedule manipulation with local-first rendering (changes appear instantly, are preserved through connectivity loss, and persist as drafts). Both ensure the guest never loses work -- whether that work is a partially filled form or a partially adjusted calendar.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: 'commit intermediate results to long-term memory or to paper.' Campbell evidence: the Date Change Tool is the hero's amulet -- it must feel like an extension of will, not a form to be re-submitted. The combined insight: save-and-resume (existing) is the general principle; local-first calendar manipulation (new) is its application to the most-used active-lease tool.

reinforcements.new_element_id: feels-001 (Prepared Vulnerability: Transforming the Belly of the Whale)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: feels-001 (Cognitive Ease as the Foundation of Trust: The First 2 Seconds Set Everything)
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the emotional state at critical first-encounter moments. The existing element covers the first 2 seconds of any new screen (cognitive ease as trust foundation). The new element covers the first hours of move-in (prepared vulnerability as the target emotional state for entering a stranger's home). Both agree that the platform must shape the user's emotional reception before content is processed.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: cognitive ease triggers feelings of familiarity and truth within 2 seconds. Campbell evidence: 'I stood before a dark cave, wanting to go in, and I shuddered' (lines 176-178) -- the shudder is not something to eliminate but to prepare for. The combined insight: cognitive ease (Kahneman) applies to digital encounters; prepared vulnerability (Campbell) applies to the physical threshold crossing. The seven-gate sequence extends the 2-second principle across a 48-hour orientation window.

reinforcements.new_element_id: feels-003 (Competent Rhythm: The Growing Ease of the Ritualized Stay Cycle)
reinforcements.existing_element_id: feels-003 (Depleted Users Need Fewer Choices, Not More Options)
reinforcements.similarity: Both prescribe that the platform's emotional scaffolding must adapt to the user's accumulated state. The existing element reduces choice presentation for depleted users. The new element progressively reduces scaffolding copy as the guest demonstrates competence across stays (full explanation at stay 1, icon-only at stay 6). Both agree: the platform's support must match the user's current capacity, not a fixed assumption of novice or expert status.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Kahneman evidence: depleted users need fewer choices. Campbell evidence: 'preliminary victories' mean the hero grows more capable with each trial. The combined insight: depletion-aware design (Kahneman) reduces friction at points of exhaustion; competence-aware design (Campbell) reduces scaffolding at points of mastery. Both produce the same UX outcome (lighter prompts over time) but for complementary psychological reasons.

reinforcements.new_element_id: feels-004 (Initiated Identity: The Apotheosis of the Experienced Guest)
reinforcements.similarity: Both address the emotional design of journey endpoints. The existing element prescribes forward momentum at every interaction close. The new element prescribes earned belonging at lease end -- the guest sees themselves as initiated, transformed, carrying a credential forward. The new element deepens the existing principle: forward momentum is the behavioral nudge; initiated identity is the emotional infrastructure that makes the forward step meaningful.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Existing evidence: forward-looking closings maintain engagement. Campbell evidence: the Bodhisattva who 'permeated the whole texture of existence with the divine grace of his assisting presence' (lines 1811-1812). The combined insight: forward momentum (existing) works at micro-interaction scale; initiated identity (new) works at macro-journey scale. The guest who feels initiated (Campbell) will naturally move forward (Kahneman) because they have something to carry.

contradictions.new_element_id: looks-001 through looks-005 (all visual elements reference tokens.json palette)
contradictions.conflict: Token palette divergence. All new elements reference tokens.json values: accent (#2d5a3d, forest green), bg (#f6f4f0), Instrument Serif, Outfit, IBM Plex Mono. The production style guide uses a purple palette: --primary-purple (#31135D), --secondary-purple (rgb(109, 49, 194)), Inter, DM Sans. Prior coherence audits have flagged this same drift. The L8 UI elements for this run will use the production purple palette and Google Fonts (Inter, DM Sans) per instructions, which means L3 token references and L8 implementations will diverge.
contradictions.evidence_comparison: The production style guide (Agents-data-source/Style-guide.md) is the authoritative source for deployed CSS variables. tokens.json represents the design system's conceptual palette. L3 elements were generated referencing tokens.json; L8 must reference production. This is a known, persistent divergence across all runs.
contradictions.recommendation: L8 UI elements will use production palette (purple) and production fonts (Inter, DM Sans) as authoritative. L3 elements retain their tokens.json references as conceptual design intent. The divergence is documented, not resolved, pending a unified token system.

extensions.new_element_id: works-001 (Recursive Trial Architecture: Each Stay Cycle as a Complete Micro-Initiation)
extensions.gap_filled: The existing library treats the stay cycle as a flat operational loop (arrival, stay, departure). No existing element prescribes visible progression across stays within a single lease. The new element fills this gap with stay-count awareness (stay 7 of 12), cumulative review visualization, progression markers at milestones (stay 3, stay 6, final), and differentiated messaging per stay number. This is the first element to address intra-lease emotional progression.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. The recursive micro-journey structure is unique to the Campbell Initiation lens and addresses a gap no other lens has illuminated: the emotional difference between stay 1 and stay 10 within the same lease.

extensions.new_element_id: works-002 (Belly of the Whale Orientation: Seven-Gate Move-In Descent)
extensions.gap_filled: The existing library has no element addressing structured pre-arrival orientation. Move-in information is covered by the House Manual but without temporal sequencing. The new element fills this gap with a countdown-anchored seven-gate notification sequence (T-48h through T+9am) that converts information dumping into ritualized progressive disclosure.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Move-in is consistently identified across runs as a high-vulnerability moment with minimal platform mediation. The seven-gate structure provides the first systematic design framework for this critical transition.

extensions.gap_filled: The existing library has trust credential architecture for proposals (communicates-003) but no element governing the information architecture of counter-offers specifically. Counter-offers are the highest-stakes negotiation surface for guests, and the person-first scan order (host identity -> host note -> term comparison -> response options) is a novel information architecture prescription.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. Counter-offer acceptance rates are a key marketplace metric, and no existing element addresses the scan-order design of the counter-offer surface. The Fergus-vs-Niall framework provides a clear diagnostic for why counter-offers fail.

extensions.new_element_id: behaves-003 (Stay Cycle Ritual Cadence: Arrival, Evidence, Reflection)
extensions.gap_filled: The existing library has the post-checkout emoji micro-review (ds-ui-004) but no element that prescribes the full three-beat ritual cadence (arrival mark, cleaning photos, review) as a unified interaction pattern. The new element fills the gap by defining the entire stay-cycle interaction sequence with progressive scaffolding reduction across stays.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. The three-beat cadence unifies three separate interactions into a single ritual architecture. The progressive scaffolding reduction (full at stay 1, minimal at stay 6) is a novel behavioral prescription that no existing element covers.

extensions.new_element_id: behaves-005 (Transformation Mirror: Mid-Lease and End-of-Lease Reflection Moments)
extensions.gap_filled: No existing element prescribes reflection surfaces at mid-lease or lease-end. The existing library has forward-momentum closings (feels-005) but no retrospective transformation mirror. The new element fills this gap with two specific surfaces: a mid-lease journey summary and an end-of-lease transformation narrative with credential visibility.
extensions.confidence_note: High confidence. The reflection moment is Campbell's Apotheosis made interactive. It addresses the retention problem from a novel angle: the guest must recognize their own transformation before they can carry it forward as a marketplace credential.

extensions.new_element_id: feels-005 (Tempered Agency: Resisting the Woman-as-Temptress Restriction)
extensions.gap_filled: No existing element addresses the emotional risk of transactional minimalism during active_lease -- the guest's temptation to restrict consciousness and disengage emotionally from the shared-living arrangement. The new element fills this gap with mid-lease expansion prompts that invite relational engagement ('What worked well this stay?') rather than evaluation ('Rate this stay').
extensions.confidence_note: Medium confidence. The Woman-as-Temptress concept is the most abstract element in this run. The practical implementation (expansion prompts at stay 3-4) is well-specified, but the emotional outcome (tempered agency) is harder to measure than other target emotions.

discovery.note: Campbell's Initiation lens focuses on post-threshold phases. Discovery is addressed conceptually (Call to Adventure) in L0 but produces no L1-L5 elements. Existing library elements from Kahneman runs cover discovery adequately.

search.note: Search is the First Threshold crossing. L0 maps Psyche's grain-sorting to the listing grid, but L1-L5 elements focus on later phases. Existing listing card elements (from prior runs) cover search.

listing_evaluation.note: L1 works-004 (Goddess Transfiguration Arc) begins at listing_evaluation with the host-as-icon stage. L3 looks-005 (Progressive Avatar) addresses the host's visual representation. Evaluation is a supporting phase, not a primary target.

proposal_creation.note: Campbell's lens treats proposal as 'the hero choosing to attempt the trial' but L1-L5 elements focus on what happens AFTER the proposal. Existing pre-populated proposal elements cover this phase.

negotiation.note: Strong coverage: works-003 (Meeting with the Goddess), communicates-003 (Counter-Offer Transparency), looks-002 (Counter-Offer Warmth), behaves-002 (Embrace-or-Dialogue), feels-002 (Relational Curiosity). Five elements across five layers address the negotiation moment.

acceptance.note: Acceptance is Campbell's Atonement. L0 provides rich conceptual framing. L1 works-004 (Goddess Transfiguration) and L2 communicates-001 (Seven-Gate) begin at acceptance (the gates start after acceptance). Acceptance itself is a single-moment phase (click 'Yes, Proceed') that existing confirmation patterns cover.

move_in.note: Strong coverage: works-002 (Seven-Gate Orientation), communicates-001 (Progressive Disclosure), looks-003 (Gate Notification Cards), behaves-001 (Gate-Sequenced Delivery), feels-001 (Prepared Vulnerability). Five elements across five layers address move-in.

active_lease.note: Strongest coverage: works-001 (Recursive Trial Architecture), works-004 (Goddess Transfiguration), works-005 (Apotheosis), communicates-002 (Trial Dashboard), communicates-004 (Amulet Framing), communicates-005 (Transformation Credential), looks-001 (Timeline), looks-004 (Cleaning Photo Frame), looks-005 (Progressive Avatar), behaves-003 (Ritual Cadence), behaves-004 (Date Change Amulet), behaves-005 (Transformation Mirror), feels-003 (Competent Rhythm), feels-004 (Initiated Identity), feels-005 (Tempered Agency). Fifteen elements address active_lease, reflecting Campbell's Initiation focus on the Road of Trials.

new_tokens_flagged.issue: New semantic token proposed in looks-001. Does not exist in production. L8 will use --secondary-purple instead.
new_tokens_flagged.risk: low -- conceptual token, production implementation will use existing purple variables

new_tokens_flagged.issue: New semantic token proposed in looks-003. L8 will use --bg-light-gray or --bg-off-white from production palette.
New semantic token proposed in looks-004. L8 will use --bg-off-white from production palette.
New semantic token proposed in looks-005. L8 will use --accent-purple as the engagement ring color.
New semantic token proposed in looks-002. L8 will use --bg-off-white.

token_compliance.production_palette_note: All L8 UI elements will use production CSS variables from Style-guide.md: --primary-purple (#31135D), --secondary-purple (rgb(109, 49, 194)), --accent-purple (rgb(140, 104, 238)), --text-dark (#1a1a1a), --text-gray (#6b7280), --bg-off-white (rgb(252, 250, 255)), --border-color (#e5e7eb). Fonts: Inter and DM Sans via Google Fonts.

meta.book: The Hero with a Thousand Faces
meta.author: Joseph Campbell
